title: Police hunt 'hired hitman' who stalked then shot dead British dad as he sat in Porsche in Thailand
text:

A British man has been assassinated after a gunman coldly opened the door of his parked Porsche and shot him twice in the head. 
Businessman Tony Kenway, 39, was pronounced dead at the scene at around 10am local time (3am UK time) this morning. 
Thai police believe the shooting - in the southern city of Pattaya - was a targeted shooting by a hired hitman linked to organised crime. 
CCTV footage released by police shows the victim get into the parked red Porsche Cayenne GTS 4x4 near Mabprachan Reservoir. Read More Tony Kenway was shot dead in the city of Pattaya (Photo: Collect Unknown) Two men were seen arriving on a motorbike (Photo: Facebook) The victim was then followed as he got into the car (Photo: Facebook) 
Police say two men then approached the scene Honda Click motorbike before one of them followed the victim knocked on the car door once he was inside. 
Mr Kenway - who is understood to have been returning to his car after visiting a nearby gym - was then shot twice in the head. 
Footage shows the shooter jogging, then calmly walking away from the scene before fleeing on the motorbike. 
Police and ambulance crews rushed to the scene outside the Sanit Sport Club but couldn't save Mr Kenway. The man is seen approaching the Porsche (Photo: Facebook) Police say the victim was then shot twice in the head (Photo: Facebook) The shooting took place outside the Sanit Sport Club in Pattaya Read More Hooligan tourists 'brawling in a Thai McDonalds' make customers scatter out of the way 
Kenway's wife Somporn, 32, told police her husband had set up a company doing website design at Jomtien Beach. A spokesman for Nong Prue Polcie in Pattaya said: ''We have started an investigation and we are looking for the attackers. The 39-year-old was shot in the southern city of Pattaya (Photo: Getty) Police in Pattaya believe the shooting is linked to organised crime (Photo: Google Maps) 
''The victim has been identified as Tony Kenway, a 39-year-old man from England. We are speaking with more witnesses.'' 
The Foreign Office confirmed a British national died in Pattaya earlier today and it is providing consular assistance to his family. 
A spokeswoman said: “We are in contact with the family of a British man following his death in Pattaya, Thailand. 
"Our sympathies are with them at this difficult time. We are in touch with the local police.” Like us on Facebook
